answers.answer: Hi,The symptoms which you are having could be due to high blood sugar as uncontrolled diabetes is known to damage the nerves resulting in the symptoms of dizziness and burning sensation. Hence, I’ll suggest you to consult an endocrinologist and ensure that your blood sugar remains in control. There are medications to take care of the pain/burning sensation but these should be taken only after consulting a physician. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care.

question: Hi I was just wondering can high blood sugar cause dizziness, sensation of skin burning and feeling bad? I have been having these feelings and when I check my sugar its good except right after I eat about 2 hours later it runs usually anywhere from 150 to 200 its scaring me to death. but I also have thyroid trouble.   I had lyme disese back in 1998 but I caught it right away and had shots at the hospital for it.
title: help
